Description: Early Chian pottery patterned chalice (reconstructed from twenty fragments) with lip, wall, handle root and part of foot preserved; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired red and mostly lost) below; exterior: mostly reserved save for double saw-edged metope pattern between groups of vertical lines in handle-zone, two narrow bands below; broad band on outer face of foot; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 19 F, pl. X, no. 3, pl. XXXIII, no. 338)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 231, no. 64)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0319) (phase 2)
